content: cc @apiraino @Joshua Nelson
love the title :laughing:
oh I was creating another one :)
it's an existential question :joy:
reference: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/245100-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization.2Falerts/topic/I-prioritize.20.2379908.20regression.201.2E49.3A.20macro_rules.20unexpected.E2.80.A6
so the discussion is about if we should prioritize when we don't have a lot of info or just wait
@apiraino have said ...

my reasoning (perhaps incorrect) is that an incomplete issue (without a clear analysis), even with a P-high label, is less useful for the team. it's like we're just signaling "hey look at this but we don't have a lot to say about it"
I don't feel super strongly about this, but I think if you do we should ask T-compiler what they'd prefer
since the whole point of this is to make things easier at the weekly meetings
my reasoning is ... I'd rather add to the agenda and have the team giving a quick look
just in case
and maybe all of us would help move things forward
but in particular, I'd rather not miss something important due to lack of some information
I'd prefer playing a bit of a guess game in certain cases
we can always lower the priority later

Joshua Nelson said:

since the whole point of this is to make things easier at the weekly meetings

I agree on :point_up: - the team has to squeeze a lot in an hour. If we just throw a P-high issue without a history they can only "take note" and nothing else
we can recognize a P-critical (in most cases)
I think a potential P-high is worth the wait
well about that maybe the question is a bit different
... meaning worth waiting a better triaging
maybe we should not do the agenda in the way we do
but that would be independent of tagging issues P-high or P-critical or P-whatever
I meant, maybe we should build the agenda using our current procedure and then remove certain things from it
I'm saying to make an agenda paying extra attention to what's going to be discussed, how much time do we have, is it important to discuss everything?, etc
like we might see that a P-critical issue is taken care and we may skip for the sake of discussing other things
the same with any other issue
we basically put in the agenda whatever our script throw at us
